Detailed Description

Get Metric Statistics Request.

Member Function Documentation

- (void CloudWatchGetMetricStatisticsRequest.)addDimension: (CloudWatchDimension *)  dimension  

Adds a single object to dimensions.

This function will alloc and init dimensions if not already done.

- (NSString * CloudWatchGetMetricStatisticsRequest.)description  

Returns a string representation of this object; useful for testing and debugging.

Returns:
A string representation of this object.
- (id CloudWatchGetMetricStatisticsRequest.)init  

Default constructor for a new object.

Callers should use the property methods to initialize this object after creating it.

Property Documentation

- (NSMutableArray *) dimensions [read, write, retain]

A list of dimensions describing qualities of the metric.

Constraints:
Length: 0 - 10

- (NSDate *) endTime [read, write, retain]

The time stamp to use for determining the last datapoint to return.

The value specified is exclusive; results will include datapoints up to the time stamp specified.

- (NSString *) metricName [read, write, retain]

The namespace of the metric.

Constraints:
Length: 1 - 255
Pattern: [^:].*
The name of the metric.

Constraints:
Length: 1 - 255

- (NSNumber *) period [read, write, retain]

The granularity, in seconds, of the returned datapoints.

Period must be at least 60 seconds and must be a multiple of 60. The default value is 60.

Constraints:
Range: 60 -

- (NSDate *) startTime [read, write, retain]

The time stamp to use for determining the first datapoint to return.

The value specified is inclusive; results include datapoints with the time stamp specified. <note> The specified start time is rounded down to the nearest value. Datapoints are returned for start times up to two weeks in the past. Specified start times that are more than two weeks in the past will not return datapoints for metrics that are older than two weeks. </note>

- (NSMutableArray *) statistics [read, write, retain]

The metric statistics to return.

Constraints:
Length: 1 - 5

- (NSString *) unit [read, write, retain]

The unit for the metric.

Constraints:
Allowed Values: Seconds, Microseconds, Milliseconds, Bytes, Kilobytes, Megabytes, Gigabytes, Terabytes, Bits, Kilobits, Megabits, Gigabits, Terabits, Percent, Count, Bytes/Second, Kilobytes/Second, Megabytes/Second, Gigabytes/Second, Terabytes/Second, Bits/Second, Kilobits/Second, Megabits/Second, Gigabits/Second, Terabits/Second, Count/Second, None
